dir-section.heading: The Environment
dir-section.p: There are about 600 protected areas in Romania, covering some 12,500 sq km. The Danube delta because of its bird population (of more than 325 species), the Retezat National Park (in the southern Carpathians) and the Rodua National Park (in the eastern Carpathians) are recognized by UNESCO as being of special ecological importance. Illegal logging has been identified as a significant problem in Romania, and in February 2020 the European Commission formally notified Romania of the need urgently to address outstanding issues. In the same month the Commission urged Romania to submit its first programme for the control of air pollution to the European Union (EU); in December 2021 the Commission agreed to refer Romania to the European Court of Justice over its failure to comply with EU requirements on clean air.

address.verbatim-address: 820243 jud. Tulcea, Tulcea, Str. Portului 34 a /3, POB 32

org-entry.content-note: reorganized in 2004
administers the infrastructure of the National Water Management System
manages state forests, conservation, processing and maintenance work
also produces timber, forest fruit, honey, seeds, game and wickerwork items

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Gheorghe Ionescu-Şişeşti Academy of Agricultural and Forestry Sciences
org-entry-head.alt-name: Academia de Ştiinţe Agricole şi Silvice Gheorghe Ionescu-Şişeşti’

org-entry.content-note: particularly involved in environmental matters through the activities of its attached institutes:

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Danube Delta National Institute for Research and Development
org-entry-head.alt-name: Institutul National de Cercetăre Dezvoltare Delta Dunării

org-entry.content-note: conservation of the diverse ecology of the Danube delta, monitoring of the wetlands, fish ecology, tourism research

org-entry-head.alt-name: Institutul de Cercetări şi Amenajări Silvice

org-entry.content-note: forest ecology, forest genetics, forest pedology and sites, forest ecophysiology, Geographic Information Systems and remote sensing, forest management planning, wildlife management, trout farming, watershed management
publishes 3 periodicals: Anale , Bucovina Forestiera

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: National Institute for Marine Research and Development
org-entry-head.alt-name: Institutul Naţional de Cercetări Dezvoltare Marină, Grigore Antipa

org-entry.content-note: studies Black Sea hydrology, ecosystems and pollution
biochemistry, extraction and utilization of aquatic living resources
aquaculture
fishery resources
marine technology

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: National Institute for Research and Development in Environmental Protection
org-entry-head.alt-name: Institutul National de Cercetare-Dezvoltare pentru Protecţia Mediului

org-entry.content-note: fmrly Environmental Engineering and Research Institute

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: National Institute of Hydrology and Water Management
org-entry-head.alt-name: Institutul Naţional de Hidrologie şi Gospodarire a Apelor

org-entry.content-note: reorganized from the National Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology

org-entry.found-date: 1866 as Societatea Literară Romãnă, present name adopted in 1948
org-entry.content-note: concerned with protection of both natural and human environments
research into numerous scientific and cultural subjects
includes a publishing house and a library

address.verbatim-address: 200403 jud. Dolj, Craiova, Str. Romul T3 B

org-entry.found-date: 1989 as the Ecological Action Romania Association
org-entry.content-note: became a foundation in 1999
present name adopted in 2003
committed to environmental issues concerning the Black Sea
also associated with the Information, Education and Resource Centre for the Black Sea (CIER)
